thread.title: Nigerian court charges 2 men carrying $5.4m in cash
thread.title_full: Nigerian court charges 2 men carrying $5.4m in cash | News24

author: news24.com
title: Nigerian court charges 2 men carrying $5.4m in cash
text:
Lagos - Nigeria's Economic and Financial Crimes Commission says two men charged with money laundering were arrested at the airport carrying $5.4m in cash and both trying to fly to China.
A statement said businessman Ojukwu Nnamdi Rowland was carrying an undeclared $2.9m when he was searched at the international airport in Lagos, Nigeria's commercial hub, on October 8.
The same day, Ngene Linus Chibuike was arrested carrying $2.5m. Both men had tickets to fly to China via Ethiopia's capital, Addis Ababa.
The commission said the two were charged at the Federal High Court in Lagos on Thursday and both pleaded innocent and were granted bail.
